org.divxdede.text.formatter

Interface PatternFormatter.ArgumentNameSpace

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    PatternFormatter.AttributeArgumentNameSpace, PatternFormatter.DetailedArgumentNameSpace, PatternFormatter.IndexableArgumentNameSpace
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    PatternFormatter.CompositeArgumentNameSpace, PatternFormatter.DefaultArgumentNameSpace
    Enclosing class:
    PatternFormatter

    public static interface PatternFormatter.ArgumentNameSpace
    An arguments namespace allow to define custom conversion's identifiers instead of using defaults.
    With a namespace, conversion's modifier can use more than one character.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      PatternFormatter.Conversion getConversion(String symbol)
      Return for a specified symbol (custom conversion's identifier) the standard conversion to use for formatting the underlying argument
      String getDateSeparator(String symbol)
      When an argument is a date-time field, a complementary date-time conversion is required.
      String[] symbols()
      Returns all conversion's identifiers handled by this namespace
      void use(String symbol)
      Invoked before using a symbol by a pattern

    • Method Detail

      • symbols

        String[] symbols()
        Returns all conversion's identifiers handled by this namespace
        Returns:
        All conversion's modifiers

      • getConversion

        PatternFormatter.Conversion getConversion(String symbol)
        Return for a specified symbol (custom conversion's identifier) the standard conversion to use for formatting the underlying argument
        Parameters:
        symbol - Custom conversion's identifier
        Returns:
        Standard conversion's modifier to use for formatting the underlying argument

      • getDateSeparator

        String getDateSeparator(String symbol)
        When an argument is a date-time field, a complementary date-time conversion is required. This method return which separator must be used to separate a specified symbol from it's date-time conversion.
        Returns:
        date-time separator to use with a specified symbol

      • use

        void use(String symbol)
        Invoked before using a symbol by a pattern
        Parameters:
        symbol - Symbol marked as used
